page.title: 01GAZETEER:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: The small{village}of Ashleworth, ( Escelenorde in Domesday Book,meaning Aescel's Enclosure ) is situated on the west bank of the {River}Severn five miles north of Gloucester.The { Church of St.Andrew and St.Bartholomew,dating from c.1100 lies a hundred metres from the river itself and has been the subject many times to flooding.The setting is quite idyllic,with Ashleworth Court (originally the Priory now a Farm) next to the church,with a magnificent tithe barn forming part of the complex along with the Boat Inn and cottages. Within living memory there was a{ferry operating from the Inn at Ashleworth Quay.The village lies up the hill with a variety of houses,some timber-framed and near the school on the Village Green.
